questions.text: Who came to the bar to see Sam?
questions.explanation:
Eddie Gordon.

	Eddie was an old drinking buddy of Sam's. He worked out of his home.

options: Sam would get a date with Jacqueline Bisset
questions.explanation:
Sam would marry Jacqueline Bisset.

	Sam said whenever he drank he always wanted Jacqueline Bisset. Eddie asked him if he always put it in writing.

questions.text: Did Sam know who the man was?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Sam didn't want to admit he didn't know who the man was so he tried to fake his way through it. He told him he'd give him a Manhattan instead of his usual and the man said that a Manhattan was his usual. He finally broke down and asked the man who he was.

questions.text: What was Sam supposed to lose if he lost the bet?
questions.explanation:
his bar.

	Sam said he always wanted Bissett when he drank Tequila. Tom, the lawyer that goes to Cheers, said because Sam was drunk the bet wouldn't hold up in court.

questions.text: Who came to the bar regarding the bet?
questions.explanation:
Jacqueline Bissett (not the actress).

	Bissett was played by Laurie Walters. She is best known for her role as Joannie Bradford on "Eight is Enough".

questions.text: Did she agree to help Sam?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	At first, she refused to help him because she didn't know him. Carla talked her into helping him.

questions.text: Who got married in this episode?
questions.explanation:
No one.

	She agreed to get married but Eddie ended up calling off the bet. His drinking buddy agreed to a smaller prize for winning so the wedding never took place.

questions.text: Who played the man who "wins" the bet?
questions.explanation:
Michael Richards.

	Michael Richards is bet known for his role as Cosmo Kramer on "Seinfeld". Richards was born in Culver City, CA on July 24, 1949.

an olive.

	Eddie saw Sam had found a woman named Jacqueline Bissett and decided not to make him go through with it. He wanted a settlement instead but ended up accepting an olive.

questions.text: Did the woman think Sam was attractive?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Jacqueline said Sam was "almost attractive as he thinks he is." She asked what kind of woman would go out with Sam and Diane avoided telling her that she had dated Sam.
